did.unittitle: United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners of America Local 337 (Whitesboro, NY) Minute Books on Microfilm, 1899-1918

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners of America (UBC)

did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Three minute books of the United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners of America, Local 337 (Whitesboro, New York), dating from 1899 to 1918.

bioghist.p: The United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners of America often referred to as the United Brotherhood of Carpenters was formed in 1881. It has grown to be one of the largest trade unions in the United States, and between its chapters and locals there is international cooperation that poises the brotherhood for a global role. Today the United Brotherhood of Carpenters is considered one of North America's largest building-trades unions, with almost a half-million members in the construction and wood-products industries.
Local 337 is located in Whitesboro, N.Y.
